title: Monitor Technician Interview

title: CT Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northside Hospital (Atlanta, GA) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: I had a single interview with three people from the department. The supervisor, lead CT Technologist and the manager of imaging. Overall the interview lasted approximately 30 minutes. The majority of the interview consisted of me speaking about my current job and why I want to work for Northside. If you have children is a good idea to make the job change more about your family versus you want to earn more money. The interviewers had an immediate relaxing of their postures and the energy changed significantly once my daughter was mentioned. Most questions were about situations in which you have had to work as a team, situations that were stressful and how well did you manage the stressful situation as it arose. I totally froze for at least 10-20 seconds on a multi faceted question regarding stressful situations but I was able to think my response though and answer more completely. I thought I bombed the question and interview but little did I know they would call me back a week later. Do not give up hope! Be yourself and let your experience shine for you. You have to believe in yourself and let them see why you are the right candidate for the job! Be honest and open with the interviewers...when and if they ask you if you would still want the job, pause for a moment in time and reply with, “ I would strongly consider the job offer. This way you don’t appear too desperate but also you don’t appear too disconnected from the possibility of landing the position. You are going to do great!!!
Interview Questions: Tell us about a stressful situation you encountered at work and explain what was stressful and how did you get through it and finish the job?

title: IT Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at Northside Hospital (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: The only way to describe this process is long and frustrating.  They are terrible at communicating and left me hanging for days in between each step and feeling strung along through the whole process.  The first part of the process is applying and their only response to this was to send the initial tests via email.  No human reached out to me to tell me more about the position or make me feel good about wanting to work there.  Days went by without a word and I had apparently passed the test someone from HR arranged a phone screen with the hiring manager.  That felt very cold and like the person was just going through motions and checking boxes on a checklist.  At no time was I ever asked if I had any questions.  Days go by again without a word and apparently I passed this portion because I was invited on site to interview in person.  For the in person I met with the boss's boss first.  This person was very personable and was very thoughtful with their style and questions.  The next person was the hiring manager.  Completely opposite experience of the first person and very cold and box checking.  I then did a panel with a few peers of the position and the boss.  Again, very cold and box checking, except I don't think they had even discussed their approach or questions beforehand because many of the questions did not apply to the position or my background.  More days go by before hearing that the hiring manager wants ANOTHER phone interview.  This time it was 30-40 pre-written personality/situational questions that were ridiculous and again mostly not relevant to the position.  More days go by, we are up to about 6 weeks of this process at this point with little to no communication at any point.  Now the HR/recruiter calls me unscheduled and asks if I have a few minutes to chat.  I'm thinking she's calling to make an offer.  Nope.  She's calling to do ANOTHER phone interview with another set of 30-40 personality/situational questions.  This took more than an hour and was completely unexpected and I had no chance to prepare for it.  After this, again, no communication.  2 more weeks go by and finally I get the generic rejection email from their application system.  I had almost forgotten about the position by the time I got the rejection email because of how long this whole process took.  After all of that time I wasted interviewing with them, they can't even bother to thank me for my time or give any feedback whatsoever.  The good news is that I don't have to work there because this experience left such a bad taste in my mouth.   I won't even go to a doctor that's affiliated with Northside even though I live 5 minutes from the main campus.  Terrible communication, long drawn out process for no reason, and just a huge waste of time.
Interview Questions: various personality, situational and questions mostly unrelated to my background

title: Communications Operator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Northside Hospital (Atlanta, GA) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: I had 3 interviews. I did two phone interviews, with the head supervisor of the communications department, for the position that I was applying for. I also did a semi phone interview, in regards to my salary, with a person in their human resource department. I was lied to about what hours I would be working, upon coming in, and doing a physical interivew in person. The head person over the department, which she did not work in the communications department, but in another department, and was over the communcations department, offered me a part-time position, and when I spoke to them on the phone, they told me a eight hour shift, from 3:00 pm to 11:00 pm, and told me what my salary would be. Upon me going to the hospital, I was given a different salary amount, and told that I would be flexible, and not a mid shift worker, which was totally different, from what I was told on the phone, and that I would be part-time / flexible. I feel that I was lied to, and that the interviewer acted, as if  they didn't know what to do with me, in regard to what shift I would be working, how they would employ me, etc. I feel that the physical interview, in how they handled me, was extremely unprofessional. I did accept the offer, and I emailed the company for my start date, and I never got a message back from them, or a phone call. I emailed them the day after my interview, and they informed, that they would get in contact with me, right after my interview, to give me a start date.
Interview Questions: Basic interview questions, and when I spoke to their human resource departments, on my third call with the company, we discuss what my salary would be, my work hours, and what shift I preferred.

title: BMTU RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Northside Hospital (Atlanta, GA) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was from out of state. I was found on LinkedIn by an outside hospital talent recruiter who noticed my year of experience as an oncology nurse. She conducted an initial phone screening. From there, I was screened by the BMT unit talent recruiter who then passed me on to a phone interview with the unit manager. The unit manager and I had a casual phone interview and then I was brought in (all expenses paid) from Illinois to Atlanta for a BMT unit interview. I was then interviewed by a panel which included the Department Manager of Oncology, BMT Unit Manager I phone interviewed with, the Clinical Supervisor, and the 2 Nurse Clinicians on the floor. I was asked the standard interview questions i.e. what made you choose nursing? Why oncology nursing? How do you handle stress? What makes you want to go into bone marrow transplant? How do you take criticism? What would you do in an emergency etc? I was immediately extended an offer and received an official online offer within 48 hours. They offered relocation and my dream job so I took it.
Interview Questions: Why bone marrow transplant?

title: CCA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northside Hospital (Cumming, GA)
Interview Descriptions:
I applied and was contacted within 1.5 weeks (use their online application management profile/ tools, it helps you track your apps and also allows you to easily apply for multiple positions). First I got a call asking me a little about myself, and was asked when I could come on-site for an interview. They set me up with an interview 1.5 weeks later. I interviewed on-site with the supervisor of the unit I applied to, and the Surgical Services manager. The interview was comfortable, and even though the hospital is HUGE, I didn't feel overwhelmed or unimportant. 

The interview was the best one I've ever had. The unit supervisor explained the work accurately, made me feel welcomed, and offered me 2 positions. I ended up taking the position I originally applied for and I'm glad I did, the unit I'm on is beautiful! 

I was contacted a day later with a job offer, and a fair, competitive pay rate, and accepted the position immediately. There is no negotiation with pay, but honestly there's not much of a reason to do so. With yearly raises, a fair rate, and countless employee discounts for various services, I have no complaints whatsoever.

title: Nurse Extern/New Grad Resident RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northside Hospital (Atlanta, GA) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions:
I interviewed at every major healthcare hospital organization in the greater Atlanta metro area this spring, and I ultimately chose Northside based on how valued I felt during this interview process, and also how accessible the HR and recruitment staff were when I had questions.  Everything was very straightforward, and every question was answered quickly. I felt like I wasn't seeking to work with them - they were seeking me as a candidate. No other hospital org did that for me, and it made a big difference.

I applied for the new grad residency program online. I was contacted and had a phone interview on a Tuesday for a Thursday in person panel interview (which was breakfast and catered). I was at the interview location for three hours with several other applicants, and then went on a tour of the Atlanta Northside facility.  We got to talk to the interview panel as a group over breakfast and then had one on one interviews. We also had access to the recruiters while we waited for our turn to interview in order to ask any and all questions we had.

We all took a shuttle over to the Atlanta campus and had a tour with a clinician who answered all our questions and oriented us to the hospital for over an hour.  We were then shuttled back to our cars.  The whole process took about 5 hours, but was very informative and relaxed.  We also got goody bags and snacks and refreshments throughout.

I was given information about salary and benefits the same day I was asked to interview, and I was called approximately 4 hours after I interviewed and was told I was getting my first choice of departments.
Interview Questions: A patient is visibly upset and wants to talk with you, but you're busy with other patients.  What do you do?

title: Environmental Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northside Hospital in May 2017
Interview Descriptions:
The hiring process takes every bit of about 2-3 weeks to even be consider and if you applied for something less then your resume. You get a call really quick and set up for an interview. The interview went great but when you seem older than the department head interviewing you its a little imitating to them. Your resume speals for you and its a shame however the first question was.
Are you applying for this job to get  feet in the door?
answer: yes because I have applied for positons that i know I'm qualified for but had to apply for a cleaning job to at least get a call. That's bad to know and then I know I nailed my interview but when you are the Environment service manager talking to a person that have way too much experience than he do. Overall I love the recruiter and the fact I got an interview. I did the background check and havent heard from one person. My interview was done on a Friday and was told you will get a call by Monday. I haven't heard anything from them. Sad outcome meaning no job offer.
Interview Questions: Are you applying for this job to get  feet in the door?

title: Pct Interview

Interview Questions: Why Northside?

title: Pct Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northside Hospital (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: nice friendly and comfortable interview that makes you feel relaxed and comfortable enough to answer the questions without getting nervous. The interview was really done on the phone, and when you go in for the interview it's just basic scenario questions.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northside Hospital (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2017

When I finally arrived at the interview, it was set up as a panel with about 6-7 people; they went around the table and asked me questions about my nursing school experience and what I hoped to gain if I became apart of the organization.
Interview Questions: What was a situation that turned negative or not desirable, and how did you handle it?

title: Catering Assistant Interview

Interview Descriptions: After I applied online, it took a month to get a call for the interview. I interviewed with the kitchen supervisor and the dept manager. It was a very unprofessional interview, we were cramped in a tiny office that was a mess with boxes and paper work everywhere. There was no organization or preparation ahead of time. The dept manager proceeded to be loud and have conversations unrelated to my interview, laughing at jokes and yelling at a worker who came in for help with a patient. She then made fun of that worker for her speech impediment. I knew before the interview started I would not accept an offer if given to me and realized it was a waste of my time.

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northside Hospital
Interview Descriptions: The typical online application, HR recruiting will call and want to set up a pre-screening interview. Basically like a practice run and the actual interview, will give you more information on the process. If chosen, then they will schedule you an interview with the nursing managers. They start with a meet and greet, then nurse education sits and talks to you about why Northside. Listen carefully during this, I used information from this portion in my interview. Then you go to your panel style interview. After, you have a brief tour of the hospital. They'll contact you in 24-48 hours, I heard back in 24 hours.
Interview Questions: Why choose Northside?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Northside Hospital (Atlanta, GA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and waited about a month before I was called by my HR recruiter and set up an interview. I was brought in for a brief interview with my HR recruiter, which was basically just me telling her about myself, and then she took me over to interview with the two managers of the department I would be working in. Once I made it past that interview, the managers set up a panel interview with my potential team members, to see if my personality worked well with the team dynamic. Everyone was very kind and welcoming, and made me feel like they wanted me there.
Interview Questions:
Describe a time where you went above and beyond for someone.
What would you do if you had too much work to do and not enough time to do it in?
They really emphasize the team dynamic, so if you're not a team player, or don't think you can be, this would not be a good job for you!

title: Radiologic Technologist - Radiation Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northside Hospital (Atlanta, GA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: There was an e-mail confirmation first to determine whether you were still interested and if so, to schedule an on-site interview.  The interview consisted of two parts, an interview with the HR personnel and afterward the chief therapist and oncologist. The interview with the chief therapist and oncologist was gear more towards the scope of the position.

title: Nurse Extern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northside Hospital in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions:
I applied on their website for the Nurse Extern position. I heard back from the recruiter with in a week or two. She interviewed me over the phone upon initial contact. Questions were very generic, like "Where do you see yourself in 5 years?" etc. She asked about my availability and when I would be graduating. She also informed me of the openings and asked that I chose my top two preferences. 

A week later, the recruiter called again to schedule and interview with the hiring managers of the two units that I was interested in. The interview with the two went fairly well. They asked questions like, "Tell us about a situation in which you felt a connection with a patient" and "Tell us about a situation in which you were asked to do something that was not part of your job description and how did you handle that?" 

About 3 days later, the recruiter called me to make an offer. I accepted immediately and was scheduled to take my drug test that same day. I completed all of the immunization screenings and within two weeks I was attending my orientation.
Interview Questions: I really didn't feel like any of the questions were difficult or unexpected.

title: Medical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northside Hospital (Atlanta, GA) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online. HR representative called to set up a phone interview and asked me to fill out background check  form and also a 6 page computerized skill test ( software by  healthcaresource) , How dare  a employer ask  for personal info before a job offer. Does the Congress need to pass a law for this, so this does not happen.

 The phone interview with hiring Manager and a Operations Manager went well, There were technical questions and also behaviour or social skills ques that are standard like conflict resolution, tardiness, communication , teamwork. punctuality,sick calls.

The HR called in 2 days for personal on site interview, They were not professional enough to give me information for parking as northside is a very big hospital,so I had to find that out on my own.  I went on time keeping the Northside values mission but HR was not ready they were 30 minutes behind schedule. The meeting was same questions HR asks, conflict managemsent etc. The recruiter had never talked to me personally before this,  She failed to give me pertinent information about the job,salary,benefits that matter for prospective  employee. In 20 minutes she was finished and asked me to go to the hiring manager in the   hospital building.  I went there and waited by the information desk for the manager to pick me up. I waited and waited and nobody would come,so finally I called the lab dept and told them I was here to see so and so for interview. I kept waiting and then sfter half and hour she came.
The interview went well,I told her HR did not give me any information about benefits and salary scale or so an had given me hints that I had lot of experience meaning I was overqualified. However the manager was very professional but was so understaffed that she had to ask another manager to take me around to show the lab so she could finish what she was doing and then show me around the area that I was supposed to work. I work in a lab so I could see that with all the procedures they do they were overworked and understaffed.I could not believe how they could maintain the quallity control and quality assurance with that kind of staff. I would think twice about visiting northside as a patient. Tere is no way such a understaffed place can produce results without making shortcuts. It is a plantation with no color bar.
Interview Questions: None of the questions were difficult, just general workplace questions. Standard HR conflict resolution questions.
